recipes.label: A Younger Sister: a Serpent
recipes.startdescription: The Serpent watches us closely, swaying its great head. WIthout Edge or Knock, we cannot prevail against it.

slots.label: Assistance
slots.description: Funds are essential for expeditions. Followers will allow me to pass obstacles.

recipes.label: Our strength is matchless.
recipes.startdescription: Eyes like gas-lamps; scales like black jade. A Serpent is a powerful foe, but it's nothing before us.

recipes.label: Our strength is considerable.
recipes.startdescription: Eyes like gas-lamps; fangs like stalactites. A great Serpent is a powerful foe, but so are we.

recipes.label: Our strength may not be enough.
recipes.startdescription: Eyes like gas-lamps; a mouth one could crouch in. We might defeat this Serpent. We might regret trying.

recipes.label: We call upon the Mother of Ants, which ariseth from wounds
recipes.startdescription: The Serpent's mouth is large enough to crouch in. Its tongue is the thickness of a man's shoulders. But almost certainly it will respect the power we bear.

recipes.label: We call upon the Mother of Ants, which encircleth
recipes.startdescription: The Serpent is long enough to coil round a cottage. Its fangs glisten like ice. Probably it will respect the power we bear.

recipes.label: We call upon the Mother of Ants, which openeth
recipes.startdescription: The Serpent rears up like swelling river. Its eyes are slitted pits of hunger. Perhaps the Serpent will respect the power we bear.

recipes.label: The Serpent's Struggles
recipes.startdescription: The Serpent rolls and roars! Its death throes shake the earth! But it's dying. We will pass.

recipes.label: The Serpent's Sorrow
recipes.startdescription: It lowers its great head. Moisture seeps from its lidless eyes. Is it weeping? What does it remember of its eldest sister, whose power we call upon?

recipes.label: The Serpent's Strength
recipes.startdescription: Back. Back! It's too much for us!

recipes.label: Watchers
recipes.startdescription: Locals with a grudge or a duty or a mercenary contract. We might trick them with Moth, seduce them with Grail, or battle them with Edge.

slots.label: Assistance
slots.description: Funds are essential for expeditions. Followers will allow me to pass obstacles.

recipes.label: Our strength is matchless.
recipes.startdescription: The Watchers will almost certainly regret standing against us.

recipes.label: Our strength is considerable.
recipes.startdescription: The Watchers aren't ready for us. We should be able to bring them down.

recipes.label: Our strength may not be enough.
recipes.startdescription: The Watchers may be too much for us - but we still have a chance.

recipes.label: Against the Watchers: The Grail's Seductions
recipes.startdescription: 'Come closer, dear ones. We have something special for you.'

recipes.label: Against the Watchers: The Grail's Temptations
recipes.startdescription: Our allures should sway the Watchers' minds.

recipes.label: Against the Watchers: The Grail's Distractions
recipes.startdescription: Perhaps we can sway the Watchers from their purpose.

recipes.label: Against the Watchers: A Powerful Deception
recipes.startdescription: 'Look closer. Closer still. Closer! Keep looking. Closer. Now close your eyes...'

recipes.label: Against the Watchers: A Likely Deception
recipes.startdescription: 'Awake! Awake! They're upon us! That way, quickly!'

recipes.label: Against the Watchers: A Desperate Deception
recipes.startdescription: 'They went... that way?'

recipes.label: The Watchers' End
recipes.startdescription: Their blood pumps bright, then dark. They should not have opposed us. We move on.

recipes.label: The Watchers' Fall
recipes.startdescription: Their present pleasures will end ill for them. Perhaps they'll think it's worth it. Meanwhile, we can pass.

recipes.label: The Watchers' Confusion
recipes.startdescription: Their bewilderment is our opportunity. We'll pass in silent secrecy.

recipes.label: The Watchers' Victory
recipes.startdescription: They are more cunning and more numerous than we'd expected! This will end in blood for us -

recipes.label: Monks
recipes.startdescription: An order of guardians bound by oath and custom. They are too steadfast for the Grail's seductions - we must defeat them with Edge or bedazzle them with Moth.

slots.label: Assistance
slots.description: Funds are essential for expeditions. Followers will allow me to pass obstacles.

recipes.label: Our strength is all but irresistible.
recipes.startdescription: We will dapple the earth with holy blood.

recipes.label: Our strength is considerable.
recipes.startdescription: We should be more than enough for these holy fools.

recipes.label: Our strength may not be enough.
recipes.startdescription: They are only monks. But they are many, many monks. We might prevail, if we're lucky.

recipes.label: The Monks: a Potent Deception
recipes.startdescription: 'We have brought here with us certain sacred texts, whose meaning is apparent only in moonlight - '

recipes.label: The Monks: a Likely Deception
recipes.startdescription: 'This writ of entry bears the seal of the highest authority. Do not stand in our way -'

recipes.label: The Monks: a Desperate Deception
recipes.startdescription: 'We have... relics. *Ancient* relics.'

recipes.label: The Monks' Silence
recipes.startdescription: Their bodies lie in robed huddles, each indistinguishable from the next. Step over, move on.

recipes.label: The Monks' Delusion
recipes.startdescription: Faith is a double-edged weapon. These monks have great talent in the matter of believing, and so they have believed our lies.

recipes.label: The Monks' Wrath
recipes.startdescription: They're stronger and wiser than we had supposed. And now their blows have found a mark -

recipes.label: The Fretful Dead
recipes.startdescription: The Dead clot in the air around us like stale corpse-light. Without Edge or Winter, we have no chance against them.

slots.label: Assistance
slots.description: Funds are essential for expeditions. Followers will allow me to pass obstacles.

recipes.label: Our strength is matchless.
recipes.startdescription: The Dead are pale as inverse shadows. They move like cobwebs in a breeze. Almost certainly, they can't stand before us. We'll send them mumbling back into the shadows of the Wood.

recipes.label: Our strength is considerable.
recipes.startdescription: These Dead, with their avid, pitiful eyes, have died once already. Their hold on the waking world is weak. We should be able to send them down into darkness, but we must take care.

recipes.label: Our strength may not be enough.
recipes.startdescription: The Dead are slow as the movement of a sundial's shadow - slow, but ceaseless. They remember pain and fear, but not clearly. We know both sensations too well. They may be too much for us.

recipes.label: We call upon the Ivory Dove, who knows the names of all the dead
recipes.startdescription: The Dead circle the edge of our vision like frayed dreams. The very air around us is chill with Winter's shadow. They must recognise that.

recipes.label: We call upon the Ivory Dove, who cannot be deceived
recipes.startdescription: The Dead watch us closely, expressionless as saint-statues. But we are invested with the power of Winter. Probably the Dead will recognise that.

recipes.label: We call upon the Ivory Dove, from whom nothing more may be taken
recipes.startdescription: The Dead boil and rattle in the darkness, but we have been touched by the Hours of Winter. Perhaps they will recognise that.

recipes.label: The Wretched Dead
recipes.startdescription: When the Dead return to us, they use what matter they can if their bodies are gone: dust, rust, cobwebs, scraps and tatters. Now that we have broken them, these tatters are all that remain.

recipes.label: The Wary Dead
recipes.startdescription: The Dead draw back, their almost-faces flat and watchful. They will not trouble us.

recipes.label: The Wrath of the Dead
recipes.startdescription: The Dead are more like wind than flesh, but it doesn't do to underestimate the wind. Just now, they are a terror-fanged hurricane of pale shadow. Fall back. Fall back!

recipes.label: Soucouyants in the Dark
recipes.startdescription: The night air rattles with them. Duck low. They are much too strong to be fought, but we may be able to deceive them, or drive them off with Mansus-light.

slots.label: Assistance
slots.description: Funds are essential for expeditions. Followers will allow me to pass obstacles.

recipes.label: We call upon the Watchman, who illuminates
recipes.startdescription: We most likely have power enough to keep them at a distance.

recipes.label: We call upon the Watchman, who is not compassionate
recipes.startdescription: Our power should be enough to hold them at bay - but they are ready for any lapse in vigilance.

recipes.label: We call upon the Watchman, who navigates
recipes.startdescription: It is possible the power we carry will see us safe through the crowded night. It's definitely possible.

recipes.label: We call upon the Moth, who seeks among the trees of the Wood
recipes.startdescription: The Moth has power in this close-crowded forest night. We will pass secretly and safely... unless we are very unlucky.

recipes.label: We call upon the Moth, who beats in the skull
recipes.startdescription: We should have power enough to deceive and dismay these night-winged thirsty ones.

recipes.label: We call upon the Moth, who is dappled
recipes.startdescription: The Moth will give us a chance in the dappled shadows of the forest - but only a chance.

recipes.label: The Soucouyants' Retreat
recipes.startdescription: They won't come close. They call out taunts in the voices of carrion birds and children; they rattle the tree-tops; they fling stones from the dark. But they won't come close. We will pass.

recipes.label: The Soucouyants' Frustrations
recipes.startdescription: Hurry from the shadow to deeper shadow. Press faces into the spongy earth. They know we're here, but they don't know where. Their cries fade behind us.

recipes.label: The Soucouyants' Hungers
recipes.startdescription: They're on us! With a leathery crack of wings, and a body is borne shrieking up into the dark -

recipes.label: The Long
recipes.startdescription: Port Noon was founded on the site of a notorious Spring: drink from it, and the world will forget you. Some among the Long have retired there from the affairs of the greater world. They don't treat trespassers kindly, and it would be foolish to assault them. But they may be susceptible to the amusements of Moth, or the seductions of Grail.

slots.label: Assistance
slots.description: Funds are essential for expeditions. Followers will allow me to pass obstacles.

recipes.label: 'We are here for your pleasure.'
recipes.startdescription: Even the Long know desire; perhaps especially the Long. This one will almost certainly yield willingly to our attentions.

recipes.label: 'We are here for your diversion.'
recipes.startdescription: This Long one welcomes our enticements, but they're still suspicious. We'll probably succeed.

recipes.label: 'We... hope we may amuse you?
recipes.startdescription: The Long have the appetites of any mortal, but they are jaded by a thousand experiences. Perhaps we might yet entertain one enough, if we're lucky.

recipes.label: 'News! News from the Old Country! From all the Old Countries!'
recipes.startdescription: The Long are desperate for novelty. We'll take advantage of that, and if all goes well we'll be gone before they know it.

recipes.label: 'Very well: a wager.'
recipes.startdescription: Is this one toying with us? It's hard to be sure. But even if this is a game, they may permit us to leave. All will probably be well.

recipes.label: 'It's, ah, er, a funny story, actually...'
recipes.startdescription: The eyes of this Long are steady and distant as the line of the horizon. Their whole body is lizard-still. Are they even listening?

recipes.label: A Long and Golden Afternoon
recipes.startdescription: Did this Long really fall prey to the Grail's seductions? Or did they know exactly what they were doing? In any case, we have won both space and time enough -

recipes.label: The Long Deception
recipes.startdescription: The immortal denizens of Noon are deceived, or amused, or caught up in the knots of a greater scheme yet. They won't interfere, this time.

recipes.label: The Long Agony
recipes.startdescription: An immortal is angry. They may choose to strike someone down, or they may withhold their anger. It's very difficult to tell, with immortals -
